DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to evaluate product performance of Magnetic Resonance (MR) Conditional Cardiac Implantable Electronic Devices (CIED) following 3 tesla (3T) MRI exposure. This will be achieved by evaluating the changes in pacing capture threshold (PCT) measurements following 3T MRI scan exposure. This study is required by FDA as a condition of approval of 3T MRI compatible labeling of applicable CIED systems. This study is conducted within Medtronic's post-market surveillance platform, the Product Surveillance Registry (PSR).
DOC.criteria: Subject or legally authorized representative provides written authorization and/or consent per institution and geographical requirements Subject is intended to be implanted or is within 30 days postimplant of a qualifying Medtronic 3T MR Conditional CIED system Subject who is, or will be inaccessible for followup at a study site Subject with exclusion criteria required by local law (Europe, Central Asia [ECA] only) Implant and followup data, including any adverse device effects and system modifications at implant through the time of enrollment are unavailable
